children.value: Status conditions are states that affect a character's behavior in various ways.
All statuses besides "Regular" can be categorized as positive or negative.
except for Super (and its boosts), Dueling, Dodger, Cautious, Reflective, and Zen.
For information about auras, check the
Negative statuses can be removed by items like
status will protect you from negative statuses)
You can check your current status from the menu. (Other â†’ Current State)
Most status conditions wear off after a number of turns, or when you change floors.
status and corresponding bonuses will remain active)
Being revived by Revival Grass or Undo Grass will remove all status conditions
except for Dodger, Cautious, Reflective, and Zen.
Negative statuses can be removed by items like
status will protect the ally from negative statuses)
Negative statuses can be removed by a
status will protect the monster from negative statuses)
Nixer Scroll will have no effect if used on a monster that has a negative status.
â€» Status names are a bit inconsistent within the game, so all alternate names are listed.

Status Target Effect Causes
Slow Shiren Perform 1 action every 2 turns. Slow Trap, Poison Grass,
Mutaikons, Mage Staff,
Slow Staff, Slow Talisman,
MC Sorceror
Ally
Monster The above, Water Pot
Swift,
Haste		 Shiren Perform 2 actions every turn. DJ Mage, Swift Grass,
Shrine Maid. Pot,
Swift Talisman
Ally
Monster The above, Swift Foe Scroll,
Gambler's Scroll
Confused Shiren Movement or attack goes in a random direction. (12 turns)
Projectiles, thrown items, and staves can be used normally.
If a direct attack turns to face an ally, it'll deal damage.		 Spin Trap, Dazikon,
MC Mage, Mage Staff,
MC Wizard, Foly,
Confusion Grass,
Conf. Talisman
Ally Moves randomly, and attacks if a creature is in the way.
Monster Moves randomly, and won't use special attacks. (20 turns)
Attacks if a creature is in the way, but the game performs
a second movement check if it's another monster, so it's
a bit rare for confused monsters to attack other monsters.		 The above,
Confusion Scroll
Asleep Shiren Unable to perform any actions. (6 turns) Sleep Trap, Mage Staff,
Sleepy Grass, Naptapirs,
Sleep Talisman, Dozikon
Ally
Monster
Sound Asleep,
Sound Sleep,
Slumbering		 Shiren Unable to perform any actions. (12 turns)
Action speed is increased by 1 stage afterward.		 Slumber Talisman
Ally
Monster The above,
Slumber Scroll
Blind Shiren Field of view reduced to zero, can't read scrolls. (10 turns)
Overwrites Farseeing status.
Check for walls using show tiles controls.
If you can detect enemies, they will be visible on the map.
(Example: having a Monster Detector equipped)
All other creatures will display as "Someone".		 Blind Trap, Kid Squids,
Drama Staff, MC Mage,
Blinding Grass
Ally Walks in a straight line until they hit something. (10 turns)
Changes directions if they hit a wall, and attacks if they
bump into Shiren, NPCs, or monsters. Monsters won't use
special attacks.
Monster The above, Darkroom
Paralyzed Shiren Unable to act until attacked or hit by an effect.
The paralysis wears off after 40 turns.		 MC Mage, MC Wizard,
Paralysis Staff,
Transient Staff,
Maneaters
Ally Unable to act until attacked or hit by an effect.
Monster The above, Fixer Scroll
S-Paralyzed,
Super Paralyzed		 Shiren Unable to act until attacked or hit by an effect 2 times.
The paralysis wears off after 40 turns.		 Paralysis Staff (blessed),
Transient Staff (blessed)
Ally Unable to act until attacked or hit by an effect 2 times.
(Changes to Paralyzed after being hit 1 time)
Monster
Empathetic Shiren When the target who inflicted this status takes damage,
Shiren or the ally receives the same amount of damage.
You won't receive damage if you defeat the target in 1 hit.
Lasts until target is gone from floor, or you change floors.		 MC Sorceror,
Sharing Staff,
Empathy Staff
Ally
Monster Target takes the same amount of damage when you're hit.
S-Empathetic,
Super Empathetic		 Shiren When the target who inflicted this status takes damage,
Shiren or the ally will receive double the amount of damage.
You won't receive damage if you defeat the target in 1 hit.
Lasts until target is gone from floor, or you change floors.		 Empathy Staff (blessed),
Sharing Staff (blessed)
Ally
Monster Target takes double the amount of damage when you're hit.
Hiding Shiren Unable to act, won't be detected by monsters. (20 turns)
Collapse if you hide while on an air or water tile.		 Hide Pot
Ally Unable to act. Won't be detected by monsters.
Break free by talking or being hit by an attack or effect.
Collapse if they hide while on an air or water tile.
Monster Unable to act, but won't be detected by other monsters.
Can't break free until they get hit by an attack or effect.
Collapse if they hide while on an air or water tile.
Cloned,
Substitution		 Shiren Same as Confused status. Clone Staff,
MC Wizard
Ally Transforms into Fake Shiren. (30 turns)
Monsters will aim for the fake, but allies won't attack it.
Trying to talk to the fake will result in attacking it.
Only 1 fake can be present, so the first character returns
to normal and is left Confused if a 2nd fake is made.
Monster Transforms into Fake Shiren. (30 turns)
Monsters will prioritize it over Shiren and his allies.
The fake won't use special attacks, and is treated as a
character on land, even if it's a Floating or Aquatic type.
Some monsters won't use special attacks if a fake is visible.
Only 1 fake can be present, so the first character returns
to normal and is left Confused if a 2nd fake is made.
Enduring Shiren Lets you survive a fatal blow with 1 HP.
Wears off after activating, or if you advance 2 floors.		 Juicy Peach
Ally
Monster
Apathetic Monster Unable to perform any actions. (6 turns) Amnesia Grass,
Gauge Blind. Trap
Berserk Shiren Player loses control of Shiren. (30 turns)
Shiren will search out and attack the nearest creature.
Won't enter walls if you have a Wall Clip Bracelet equipped.		 Rage Grass,
Mesmerikon,
MC Wizard, Foly,
Berserker Tal.
Ally Can't use special attacks. Attacks nearest creature. (30 turns)
Monster Can't use special attacks. Attacks nearest creature. (30 turns)
Night monsters are immune to this status.
Shadow Bound Shiren Prevents movement. Can attack, change direction. (3 turns) Shadow Bind Tal.,
Shadow Bind Trap,
Foly
Ally Prevents movement. Can attack, change direction.
Monster Prevents movement. Can attack, change direction. (10 turns)
Afraid Shiren Reverses direction of attacks and thrown items. (15 turns)
Movement is not affected.		 Fear Talisman
Ally Reverses direction of attacks. (15 turns)
Can't use special attacks.
Monster The above, Fear Scroll,
Dicey Distractor
Sealed Shiren Same as Muzzled, but also can't use staves. (20 turns)
However, you can still eat peaches.		 Seal Staff, MC Wizard,
Seal Talisman
Ally Can't use special attacks, and can't talk to Shiren. The above, Imabikiso
Monster Can't use special attacks or abilities.
Action speed is unchanged.		 The above, Water Pot,
Room Sealant
Inaccurate Shiren Direct attacks will always miss. (10 turns)
If target is Asleep or Paralyzed, the attack will still connect.		 Inacc. Talisman, Foly
Ally Direct attacks will always miss. (10 turns)
Monster
Onigiri Shiren Transforms into an onigiri. (10 turns)
Attack and defense set to 0, and equipment effects nullified.
Can't use items, abilities, ascend or descend stairs.
Collapse if you get hit by fire or explosion damage,
or if you step on a Decay Trap or land on a water tile.		 Onigiri Trap, Nigiri Boss,
MC Sorceror, Nigiri King
Ally
Monster Transforms into an onigiri. (10 turns)
Attack and defense set to 0, and can't use special attacks.
Turns into a Grilled Onigiri if hit by fire or explosion damage.
Turns into a Rotten Onigiri if it steps on a Decay Trap,
gets splashed by water (Water Pot), or lands on a water tile.
Nigiri Baby monsters are immune, and will be Buffed instead.		 The above,
Onigiri Bonanza
Tottering Monster Unable to act, and receives double damage. (6 turns)
If the target is Mixer, it will drop eaten items on the ground.		 Oil Scroll
Enraged,
Rage		 Shiren Doubles attack power. (15 turns) Enraged Talisman
Ally
Monster Doubles attack power. (50 turns) The above, Rage Trap
Furious,
Super Enraged		 Shiren Doubles attack power and grants Swift status. (15 turns) Furious Talisman
Ally
Monster Doubles attack power and grants Swift status. (15 turns)
(Can attack 2 times per turn)
Plated,
Plating		 Shiren Character is immune to most attacks and traps.
Chance to wear off when hit by attacks or trap effects.		 Mekky (NPC)
Ally
Farseeing Shiren Reveals hidden traps, lets you read scrolls in the dark.
Overwrites Blind status.
Wears off if you're inflicted with Blind or if you change floors.		 Perception Grass
Ally Overwrites Blind status.
Monster
Gauge Blind,
Gauge Vanish		 Shiren HP and fullness bars are hidden. (100 turns)
Other stats show as ????, preventing checking current status.		 Gauge Blind. Trap
Muzzled Shiren Unable to eat, read, use abilities, or talk.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Muzzled Scroll
Grounded Shiren Unable to pick up items. Can still use items on the ground.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Grounded Scroll, Foly
Hypnotized Shiren Face a random direction and attack, use an item,
or throw an item. (1 turn)		 Gazers
Ally Same as Confused status.
Monster
Grassnesia Shiren Unable to use or throw grass items. (100 turns) Myriman
Scrollnesia Shiren Unable to use or throw scrolls. (100 turns) Billman
Staffnesia Shiren Unable to use or throw staves. (100 turns) Trillman
Potnesia Shiren Unable to use or throw pots. (100 turns) Googoman
Laughing Shiren Unable to perform any actions. (6 turns) Hilarious Pot
Ally
Monster Unable to perform any actions. (6 turns)
Spreads to adjacent enemies and other enemies in the room.
All enemies stop laughing when one enemy recovers.
Napping Monster The monster is sleeping and won't wake up on its own.
May wake up if you move next to it, or enter / exit the room.
Floaty, Karakuroid, and Zalokleft always spawn napping,
along with monsters inside regular Monster Houses.		 -
Invincible Shiren Nullifies all damage received. (20 turns)
It doesn't protect against effects unrelated to damage.		 Invincible Grass,
Shrine Maid. Pot
Ally
Monster
Potted Shiren Hand is stuck in a pot, and your weapon is unequipped.
Unable to pick up or use items, and can't use abilities.
Wears off when you change floors, or step on a Strip Trap.
Chance to break free when you attack or get hit by enemies.		 Sticky Pot
Tinkerer,
Reinforcer		 Shiren Gain x4.0 equipment skill points from enemies. (100 turns)
Wears off when you change floors.		 Upgrade Seed
Cannon Arm Shiren Thrown items, projectiles go through walls and creatures.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Dracon Grass
Immune Shiren Character is immune to negative status conditions.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Immunity Scroll,
Peach (blessed)
Ally
Monster Monster is immune to negative status conditions. Peach (blessed)
Klein Shiren Attack power and defense are switched. (20 turns)
Wears off when you change floors.		 Klein Pot
Ally Attack power and defense are switched. (20 turns)
Monster
Fast Regen Shiren Increases natural HP regeneration per turn by 1 HP.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Self-Help
Night Vision Shiren Lets you read scrolls in the dark.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Beacon of Light
Zen,
Reflector		 Shiren Makes characters immune to fire and explosion damage.
Dragon, Firepuff, Pop Tank, Explochin special attacks,
Explosion traps, Explosion Bracelet, 4-2-8 and Fever pots.
Onigiri can still be grilled. Won't collapse if Onigiri status.
Wears off if you change floors. (Reviving doesn't remove it)		 Zen Pot
Ally
Monster
Dodger Shiren Projectiles and thrown items always miss.
Bored Kappa, Field Knave, Porky, Scoopie, Mutaikon,
Bow Boy, and Grass Boy special attacks.
Wears off if you change floors. (Reviving doesn't remove it)		 Dodger Pot
Ally
Monster
Reflective,
Cautious		 Shiren Reflects all magic.
DJ Mage, Gazer, and Polygon Spinna special attacks.
Gazer's hypnosis is reflected as confusion, and
Polygon Spinna's special attack is reflected as damage.
Wears off if you change floors. (Reviving doesn't remove it)		 Reflection Pot
Ally
Monster
Cautious,
Watcher		 Shiren Won't drop items, and others can't steal or parry your items.
Zalokleft, Froggo, Gyadon, Swordsman, higher level
Field Knave special attacks, and Trip Traps.
Wears off if you change floors. (Reviving doesn't remove it)		 Perceptive Pot
Ally
Monster
Ninja,
Tiptoe		 Shiren Napping monsters won't wake up when you move next to
them or when you enter or exit the room.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Special Onigiri
Knowledgeable,
Mass Identifier		 Shiren Items are identified when picked up or inserted into pots.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Special Onigiri
Satiated Shiren Stops natural fullness depletion.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Special Onigiri
Insomnia Shiren You won't fall asleep.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Special Onigiri
Unwavering,
Power Save		 Shiren Your strength can't be decreased.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Special Onigiri
Starving,
Hunger		 Shiren Natural HP regeneration stops, lose 1 HP every turn.
Canceled when your fullness increases above 0.		 Fullness reaches 0
Danger,
Pinch		 Shiren Shiren's current HP is < 30% of his max HP. (Red HP bar)
Canceled when Shiren's HP > 30% of his max HP.		 HP < 30% of max HP
Buffed,
Empowered		 Shiren Boosts damage dealt by 50% per stage. (8 stages max)
Stages: 150%, 200%, 250%, 300%, 350%, 400%, 450%, 500%.		 Power Up Grass
Ally Power Up Grass,
Strength Grass
Monster
Weakened Shiren Reduces damage dealt by about 50%. (8 stages max)
Stages: 50%, 60%, 70%, 80%, 90%, 95%, 97%, 99%		 Rotten Peach
Ally Rotten Peach, Strip Trap,
Poison Grass, Water Pot,
Poison Arrow, Hunger Trap
Monster
Bolstered,
Fortified		 Shiren Reduces damage received by about 50%. (8 stages max)
Stages: 50%, 60%, 70%, 80%, 90%, 95%, 97%, 99%		 Hard Peach
Ally
Monster
Wizened Shiren Boosts damage received by 50% per stage. (8 stages max)
Stages: 150%, 200%, 250%, 300%, 350%, 400%, 450%, 500%.		 Rotten Peach
Ally Rotten Peach, Strip Trap,
Rust Trap
Monster
Dueling Monster Monster may drop a license when defeated. (20 turns)
(Shiren must be the one to defeat it)		 Duelist Trap
Awakened-ish,
Nearly Awakened		 Shiren May occur when defeating enemies.
Chance to wear off when a hunger message is displayed,
turns elapse while you're Starving or in Danger, you step on
a trap, or get inflicted with a negative status condition.		 Chance to occur when
you defeat enemies
during an adventure
Super Shiren May occur when defeating enemies while Awakened-ish.
Gain 1 of the following every 10 enemies you defeat:
Overwhelming, Indomitable, Modder, Super Swift,
Fast Striking, Precise.
Direct attacks have a chance to inflict Confused, Blind,
Berserk, Asleep, Paralyzed, Sealed, or Shadow Bound.
Chance to wear off when a hunger message is displayed,
turns elapse while you're Starving or in Danger, you step on
a trap, or get inflicted with a negative status condition.
(Lose all bonuses when it wears off)		 Chance to occur when
you defeat enemies
while Awakened-ish
Overwhelming Shiren Same as Buffed status, but lasts 3 floors. Super status
Indomitable Shiren Same as Bolstered status, but lasts 3 floors. Super status
Super Swift Shiren Same as Swift status, but lasts 50 turns.
(100 turns from Shiren's perspective)		 Super status
Modder Shiren Same as Tinkerer status, but lasts 2 floors. Super status
Fast Striking,
Swift Striking		 Shiren Perform 2 direct attacks per turn. (50 turns) Super status
Precise,
Deadly Accurate		 Shiren Direct attacks always deal a critical hit. (50 turns) Super status
Doub-ility ??? Status condition in the game files.
No description.		 Water Pot effect that
makes monsters use
special attacks often?
Tame ??? Status condition in the game files.
No description.		 Tamed monsters?
(Monster Licenses)
Wait ??? Status condition in the game files.
No description.		 ???
ChestnutCount ??? Status condition in the game files.
"While in this state you'll earn extra
experience points for defeating enemies."		 Sweet Nuts eating items?

export const _frontmatter = {"title":"Status Conditions","metaTitle":"Status Conditions - Shiren the Wanderer: Tower of Fortune Wiki","metaDescription":"List of status conditions for Shiren the Wanderer: The Tower of Fortune and the Dice of Fate."}

val.rawMDXOutput:
/* @jsx mdx */ import { mdx } from '@mdx-js/react'; /* @jsxRuntime classic */ /* @jsx mdx */ export const _frontmatter = { "title": "Status Conditions", "metaTitle": "Status Conditions - Shiren the Wanderer: Tower of Fortune Wiki", "metaDescription": "List of status conditions for Shiren the Wanderer: The Tower of Fortune and the Dice of Fate." }; const layoutProps = { _frontmatter }; const MDXLayout = "wrapper" export default function MDXContent({ components, ...props }) { return
{` `}{` `}{` `}{` All statuses besides "Regular" can be categorized as positive or negative.`}

{`Absorbiphant`}{` monsters and the Sparrow `}{`NPC`}{` can remove all status conditions`}
{` except for Super (and its boosts), Dueling, Dodger, Cautious, Reflective, and Zen.`}

{`For information about auras, check the `}{`Gameplay Basics`}{` page.`}

{`Shiren`}

  • {`Negative statuses can be removed by items like `}{`Peach`}{`, `}{`Fixer Scroll`}{`, or `}{`Immunity Scroll`}{`.`}
    {`(`}{`Immune`}{` status will protect you from negative statuses)`}
  • {`You can check your current status from the menu. (Other â†’ Current State)`}
  • {`Most status conditions wear off after a number of turns, or when you change floors.`}
  • {`(However, `}{`Super`}{` status and corresponding bonuses will remain active)`}
  • {`Being revived by Revival Grass or Undo Grass will remove all status conditions`}
    {`except for Dodger, Cautious, Reflective, and Zen.`}

{`Allies`}

  • {`Negative statuses can be removed by items like `}{`Peach`}{` or `}{`Immunity Scroll`}{`.`}
    {`(`}{`Immune`}{` status will protect the ally from negative statuses)`}

{`Monsters`}

  • {`Negative statuses can be removed by a `}{`Peach`}{` or `}{`Cure Monster Trap`}{`.`}
    {`(`}{`Immune`}{` status will protect the monster from negative statuses)`}
  • {`Nixer Scroll will have no effect if used on a monster that has a negative status.`}

{`Status List`}

{`Key: `}{`Positive`}{`, `}{`Negative`}{`, `}{`Special`}
